page.title: 03 DUNSWELL
page.content: Away from the main road are { {Dunswell Lane}(going west to Cottingham) and{Ings Lane}(going east to thre River Hull).{Dunswell Lane}is a mixture of old cottages and recently-built bungalows, especially near{Barmston Drain},a popular angling spot.{Ings Lane}nursery is actually a garden centre, well used by visitors from Hull.Further produce is supplied by two farms within the village. The local primary (4-11) is Dunswell school (opened 1881) situated on the main road and next to the public house,the Coach and Horses. There are 59 children, three teachers and a secretary in cramped buildings with a small playground. However the few functions held in the village occur at the {Institute}not far away.
